title: 'I was on fire': Dad shot by neighbor while protecting girl
description: As the bullet pierced his lung and liver, the only thing Jamie White could think about was getting his 6-year-old daughter to safety

title: Russia’s Lavrov spars with Western officials at U.N.
description: In a contentious meeting at the Security Council, the Russian foreign minister attempted to deflect criticism of his country’s invasion of Ukraine.

title: As Sudan’s capital burns, the Darfur region negotiates a fragile truce
description: But fighting continues elsewhere in the country between forces backed by rival generals Burhan and Hemedti

title: 19 Kenyan students arrive from Sudan aboard military plane
description: The first group of Kenyan evacuees from Sudan have landed in the country’s main airport

title: Mexico finds 11,520 tequila bottles with liquid meth at port
description: Inspectors from the Mexican Navy say they have found 11,520 tequila bottles bound for export that actually contained concentrated liquid meth

title: Pope Francis hopes to visit native Argentina next year
description: Pope Francis said he hopes to travel to his home country of Argentina in 2024, which would mark the first time he would step foot in his homeland since becoming pontiff a decade ago

title: Migrants walking through Mexico threaten road blockades
description: Around 3,000 migrants walking through southern Mexico in a mass protest procession have threatened to block roads or harm themselves unless the government agrees to talks or provides them buses

title: Pakistani police say 2 blasts at facility in NW kill 12
description: Police say two explosions at a counterterrorism police facility in northwest Pakistan have killed at least 12 people and wounded at least 50

title: Blackout-beset South Africa may delay closing coal stations
description: President Cyril Ramaphosa says South Africa may delay the timetable for shutting down many of its highly polluting coal-fired power stations as the nation deals with crippling daily electricity blackouts

title: Mob in Haiti capital burns to death 13 suspected gangsters
description: Police and witnesses say a mob in the Haitian capital has beaten and burned 13 suspected gang members to death with gasoline-soaked tires after pulling the men from police custody at a traffic stop

title: Fatal beating of psychiatrist in Italy sparks reforms outcry
description: The fatal beating of a hospital psychiatrist, allegedly by a former patient, has sparked calls in Italy to improve mental health care

title: Oscar-nominated composer writes march for Charles' big day
description: From the Oscars to the Coronation: Scottish film composer Patrick Doyle has been commissioned to write the music for King Charles’ Coronation March which will debut, in front of the world, at the royal event at Westminster Abbey on Saturday, May 6

title: Serbian leader lashes out at the West over Kosovo vote
description: The Serbian president has sharply criticized Western officials who are mediating talks on normalizing ties with Kosovo, calling them liars and fraudsters, and says the Serb minority in the former Serbian province won’t tolerate foreign “occupation.”

title: Which countries are evacuating citizens from Sudan?
description: Hundreds of foreign nationals have been safely evacuated from Sudan where continued fighting threatens to plunge the African country deeper into chaos

title: In photos: Diplomats evacuated from Sudan as fighting continues
description: More foreign powers evacuated diplomatic staff from Sudan on Sunday despite continued fighting between the Sudanese army and paramilitary forces in the capital, Khartoum, that has trapped millions of civilians on the front line.

title: Report: Yacht with 3 Russians, 2 Egyptians missing off Yemen
description: A yacht carrying three Russians and two Egyptians has reportedly gone missing days ago off the coast of Yemen in the Red Sea

title: Kenya president says cult deaths akin to terrorism
description: Kenya’s president says the starvation deaths of dozens of followers of a pastor is akin to terrorism

title: Moscow court rejects appeal from cafe bombing suspect
description: A Russian court has rejected an appeal from a suspect in a bombing that killed a well-known Russian military blogger

title: Watchdog: World military spending up to an all-time high
description: A Sweden-based watchdog says global military spending grew for the eighth consecutive year in 2022 to an all-time high of $2.24 trillion

title: Hundreds of migrants reach Italian isle; 20 reported missing
description: Hundreds of migrants have arrived over a 24-hour period on a tiny Italian island

title: Israeli FM demands arrested Jordanian lawmaker 'pay a price'
description: Israel’s foreign minister has called on Jordan to bring to justice a Jordanian lawmaker who was arrested in Israel for allegedly trying to smuggle weapons into the occupied West Bank

title: 3 men arrested in South Africa for stealing large crocodile
description: Police say they have arrested three men in South Africa for stealing a 2.5-meter (8-feet) long Nile crocodile worth about $1,300 from a farm in the North West province

title: Prominent Chinese journalist faces espionage charges
description: Dong Yuyu, a former Harvard University journalism fellow, was detained in February, in the latest sign of how boundaries are being redrawn in Xi Jinping’s China.

title: Palestinians: Israeli troops kill man in West Bank raid
description: A Palestinian official says Israeli forces operating in a refugee camp in the occupied West Bank killed a Palestinian man

title: Drones attack Sevastopol, crashed drone found near Moscow
description: Russian-appointed authorities in Crimea say the military fended off a Ukrainian strike on the port of Sevastopol, while a drone was also reportedly found in a forest near Moscow

title: Foreigners airlifted out; Sudanese seek refuge from fighting
description: Foreign government have airlifted hundreds of diplomats and other citizens out of Sudan, and several governments have said more evacuations are possible if security conditions allow

title: At U.S. behest, Ukraine held off anniversary attacks on Russia
description: Kyiv’s head of military intelligence, Kyrylo Budanov, planned bold strikes deep behind enemy lines that unnerved officials in Washington.

title: DeSantis meets with Japanese leader in first stop of international trip
description: Florida Gov. Ron DeSantis met with Japan's prime minister, as the likely GOP presidential contender swings through four of the biggest U.S. allies.

title: A cult advised starving for salvation, police say. Dozens have died.
description: Authorities believe those found dead in a Kenyan forest were followers of pastor Paul Mackenzie’s Good News International Church.

title: Syrian state media say Israeli artillery shells border town
description: Syrian state media say Israel shelled targets in southern Syria, near the Israeli-occupied Golan Heights

title: Amazon Indigenous woman wins Goldman environment prize
description: Alessandra Korap, a Munduruku Indigenous woman from the Brazilian Amazon, has been awarded the prestigious Goldman Environmental Prize for her work fighting against illegal mining and large-scale projects aimed at facilitating soybean exports in the Tapajos River Basin

title: The man in a hurry: King Charles III rushes to make a mark
description: King Charles III is a man in a hurry

title: For protesters pardoned in Iran, freedom comes with no guarantees
description: The Washington Post spoke to three Iranians affected by a recent amnesty, as the authorities seek to restore order after months of anti-government protests.

title: Climate protesters try to bring Berlin traffic to a halt
description: German climate activists were trying to bring traffic to a standstill in Berlin by gluing themselves to roads all over the capital

title: Ukraine live briefing: War pushes global defense spending to record high; Russia says U.S. withheld journalist visas
description: Global defense expenditure rose to $2.24 trillion in 2022, with Russia and Ukraine notably increasing their budgets, according to a Swedish think tank.

title: Ukraine, China main focus as South Korean president visits White House
description: In an interview ahead of his trip to Washington, South Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol spoke about his career, life and his country’s alliance with the U.S., which marks 70 years this year.

title: As Russians plot against Chad, concerns mount over important U.S. ally
description: But critics say the Biden administration is making a mistake by giving Chad a pass over violence and repression at home.
